action.action-desc: Mr. Kildee introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to make the health coverage tax credit permanent.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Bob von Schwedler Permanent Health Coverage Tax Credit Expansion Act.

section.header: Permanent credit for health insurance costs

subsection.text: Section 35(b)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: The term eligible coverage month means any month if, as of the first day of such month, the taxpayerâ€”

subparagraph.text: is covered by qualified health insurance, the premium for which is paid by the taxpayer,
does not have other specified coverage, and
is not imprisoned under Federal, State, or local authority.

subsection.text: Section 35(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking 72.5 percent and inserting 80 percent.

paragraph.text: Section 35(e)(2)(B)(i) is amended by striking clauses (iii) and (iv) of subsection (b)(1)(A) and inserting subparagraphs (C) and (D) of subsection (b)(1).
Subsections (b) and (e)(1) of section 7527 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are each amended by striking 72.5 percent and inserting 80 percent.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to coverage months beginning after December 31, 2021.
